lines.text: [last lines]
Merry Christmas. Merry Christmas, Mr. Lawrence!

[eating flowers]
Well I've tried the Manju, and I've tried the flowers, and I think the flowers taste better.
Today, I am Father Christmas.
[Jack is being led to the firing squad]

[Chuckles]
Can you guess what I'm thinking?
Yes, I think so. Can you?
You are the victim of men who think they are right... Just as one day you and captain Yunoi believed absolutely that you were right. And the truth is of course that nobody is right...
To be or not to be, that is the question.
God, I wish they'd stop hitting me.
There are times when victory is very hard to take.
You know you don't have to obey this man, Lawrence.
Well, I'm the liaison officer, so I'm liaising.

[to Yonoi]
It's your gods. It's your bloody, awful, stinking gods. They made you what you are. May they rot away in the filthy hell they came from!

[about something Yonoi just said]
What the hell's Gyo?
Uh... It's a Japanese word for laziness.
Laziness! Jesus Christ, what makes he...
Why don't you listen? He means spiritual laziness, and he believes that if he takes away the food and the water, then he also takes away the nourishment of laziness.
You don't believe this bull shit!
I don't fucking know! Sir, I will tell you something that may surprise you! If we'll do it, he'll do it.
Lawrence... We're going walkies.
Jack...
Now listen, we're getting out of here. You're going over my shoulder.
We can't, Jack. The tube line doesn't come out this far.
It's okay. Everything's all right. Captain Yonoi gave me a Persian rug.
Look, why don't I have a defense council? Excactly what kind of trial are you giving me? This whole thing's a bloody farce.

[In Japanese]
The previous comments are to be struck from the protocol.
Why do you not fight me? If you defeat me, you will be free!
[first lines]

[in Japanese]
Wake up, Lawrence.

[in Japanese]
What is it? Why so early, Sergeant Hara?

[in Japanese]
Hurry up!
What does he want?

[in English]
I'll find out?

[in Japanese]
What?
You don't have to take orders from this man, you know, Lawrence.
Well, I'm the liaison officer, so I'm liaising.

[in Japanese]
What did he say?
You're sure you know what you're doing, old man?
Yes, and whatever this is, it's important to him that I see it.
[in Japanese]
Let's go, Sergeant.

[in Japanese]
You don't understand. Only Lawrence understands.
I'll keep an eye on them, sir.
Very good.

[Sgt. Hara whacks the POW on the head with a bamboo cane. The POW collapses in pain and blood spills from his injury]
Bastards!

[about to be led to the firing squad, mimes shaving with a straight razor, impersonating two people having a conversation]
Good day for it, sir.
Yes... You have family waiting for you, corporal?
Wife and two kids, sir. One with and one without. How's about yourself, sir?
[mimes eating from his palm, then crying for a moment]
Tea?
Yes, I'd like that.
[mimes drinking, then smoking and crushing an imaginary cigarette]

[talking to Jack through the wall dividing two holding cells]
You should have joined the Foreign Legion, Jack. It would have been an easier life.
That's the last thing I want.

[hearing the soldiers approaching]
Ah, here comes the milkman now!

[joins in the joke]
Two pints?
Shouldn't we order an extra one? It's Christmas, remember?

[patters]
Heavens, Christmas already. Well, it was lovely chatting but I really must fly.

[laughs]
It's not you. They've come for me!
[being dragged out of the cell]

[being dragged too]
How is it John you're always wrong?

[about the Japanese]
They were a nation of anxious people... and they could do nothing individually. So they went mad... en masse.
